events.name: [Professional Talk] Internet of Everything- Smart City, Applications & Approach
events.description: “The Internet of Everything is a $19 trillion global opportunity over the next decade: Private-sector firms can create as much as $14.4 trillion of value while cities, governments and other public-sector organizations can create $4.6 trillion”- Cisco Indian Institute of Technology, Alumni Association Singapore-entrepreneurship Cell (IITAAS- eCell) and AllThingsConnected-Alliance, Singapore Meetup (ATCAlliance) invite you to a Professional Talk on Internet of Everything- Smart City, Applications and Approach. If you are an individual, an application developer, a researcher, a startup, or an industry expert working in this exciting area; you will certainly be benefited hearing our two expert speakers. REGISTER HERE: SESSION 1 - The “E Pluribus Unum” Agenda for Mobiles, Wearables & IoT Dr. Archan Misra (Associate Professor of Information Systems) Dr Archan will highlight the trends in urban mobile analytics and applications. Then share work at SMU and elsewhere related to the use of crowd-sourcing for a variety of urban applications, ranging from retail management, logistics and smart campus monitoring. Also, how these capabilities can be combined with the recent emergence of IoT/infrastructure platforms (e.g., BLE beacons). Profile SESSION 2 - Cisco’s approach on Smart City & Nation- Technology and Platforms for application development Jared Danaraj (Director, Industry Solutions and Ecosystems, APJC) Jared manages the regional GTM strategy for Industry Strategic Partnerships in key sectors such as Manufacturing, Energy & Power, Cities and Transportation. He also leads Cisco's Internet of Everything (IoE) Solutions GTM with partners in APJC. Profile WHEN Monday, 6th April’15: 6:30pm- 8:30pm · 6:30- 7:00pm- Networking & Introduction · 7:00- 7:30pm- Session 1 · 7:30- 7:45pm- Break and Networking · 7:45- 8:15pm- Session 2 · 8:15- 8:30pm- Q & A WHERE Venue Sponsor- School of Information Systems, SMU · SIS Seminar Room 2-4, Level 2, School of Information System, SMU, 80 Stamford Road, Singapore[masked] · Map- http://tinyurl.com/kyzm93d REGISTER HERE: We would like to thank the speakers on behalf of organisers for providing their invaluable time, and participating in our efforts to bring you this series of talks on this exciting area of All Things Connected. Note: While this is a free talk, and we would like to have as many as participants possible to accomodate- but seats are obviously limited. We seek your understanding to register only if you are sure to attend the talk, this is to avoid any disappointments to the others, the organisers and the speakers. - Organising team
events.location: School of Information System, SMU, SIS Seminar Room 2-4, Level 2,School of Information System, SMU, 80 Stamford Road, Singapore

events.name: Coding Dojo + Q & A with Bill Venners
events.description: By popular demand, it's time for a bit of Dojo coding again. The problem is available at: https://github.com/SingaporeScalaProgrammers/gokata If you are just beginning to learn Scala, this is a great way to learn from more experienced developers in friendly environment. If you are a pro then this is a great opportunity to flex your skills and make everyone see how super-awesome you truly are. So there is something for everyone see.. As an added bonus, Bill Venners, the lead designer and developer of ScalaTest, renowned author and speaker will be dropping in via Skype to answer your questions. Still not enough? Ok then, everyone who attends will get a free copy of a new Scala testing tool called SuperSafe! Phew... See you all there
events.location: ThoughtWorks office, 87B Amoy Street, Level 3, Singapore
